feedback.content: Sold my private helicopter to this company in Miami. They were professional, offered a competitive price, and managed all the details. Appreciated their expertise in the rotorcraft market. A top-notch service!
feedback.name: Elizabeth C.

feedback.content: These folks bought my small helicopter. The offer was fair, and they were flexible with the inspection and pickup. Only giving 4 stars because the initial response was a bit slow, but otherwise a smooth transaction.
feedback.name: James H.

feedback.content: Parting with my chopper was bittersweet, but these guys made it easier. They knew their stuff about helicopters and offered a good price. The whole process was efficient and hassle-free. Thumbs up!
feedback.name: Laura M.

listAsq.title: What types of helicopters do you buy?
listAsq.content: Our company specializes in purchasing a wide range of helicopters, including ultralight helicopters, light single-engine helicopters, medium single-engine helicopters, multi-engine helicopters (medium and heavy), and helicopters designed for VIP and corporate transportation. We consider all makes and models from major manufacturers such as Bell, Airbus Helicopters, Sikorsky, Leonardo, Robinson, and others.

listAsq.title: How do you value helicopters
listAsq.content: Our valuation process is comprehensive and takes into account multiple factors. We consider the helicopter's make, model, year, total time on airframe and engine(s), avionics suite, maintenance history, and current market conditions. Our team of experienced appraisers uses industry-standard valuation tools and current market data to provide a fair and competitive offer.

listAsq.title: Can I sell a financed helicopter?
listAsq.content: Yes, we are experienced in purchasing helicopters with existing financial obligations. We can work with financed helicopters at any stage of the loan repayment process, as well as leased helicopters both under active agreements and those that have completed their lease terms. Our team is skilled in navigating the complexities of these transactions to ensure a smooth process for all parties involved.

listAsq.title: What paperwork is needed?
listAsq.content:
To facilitate a smooth transaction, we typically require the following documentation:
  • Aircraft registration certificate
  • Airworthiness certificate
  • Logbooks (airframe, engine, and rotor)
  • Maintenance records
  • Any Supplemental Type Certificates (STCs) or modifications
  • Bill of sale
  • Lease or finance agreements (if applicable) Our team can guide you through the documentation process to ensure all necessary paperwork is in order.

listAsq.title: How quickly can the sale be completed?
listAsq.content: The timeline can vary depending on the complexity of the transaction, but we strive for efficiency. Once we've agreed on a price and all documentation is in order, we can typically complete the transaction within 5-7 business days. In some cases, we can expedite the process if needed.

listAsq.title: How does the inspection process work?
listAsq.content: Our inspection process is thorough yet efficient. We dispatch a qualified aviation inspector to conduct an on-site evaluation of the helicopter. This includes a detailed examination of the airframe, engines, avionics, and a review of all maintenance records. We also perform a test flight when possible. Our goal is to complete the inspection with minimal disruption to your operations.

listAsq.title: Do you operate throughout the entire United States?
listAsq.content: While our primary network doesn't cover the entire United States, we have strategic partnerships that allow us to work with customers across the country. We can arrange for the inspection and pickup of the helicopter from any location. For more distant locations, please allow an additional 1-2 days for our team to make necessary arrangements. We are committed to providing high-quality service to every customer, regardless of their location.
